title: Gattaca
description: In a future society in the era of indefinite eugenics, humans are set on a life course depending on their DNA. Young Vincent Freeman is born with a condition that would prevent him from space travel, yet is determined to infiltrate the GATTACA space program.

reviews.text: This can easily be our future. I like those science fiction/dystopian movies which show how technology can affect our future in a realistic way. Jude Law's most subtle acting yet. Ethan Hawk was also good. Very emotional and realistic. The low budget did not hurt the movie at all in my opinion. Recommended!

Every time I meet some self proclaimed "movie buff" who has never seen this movie I find myself shaking my head in amazement.  This gem of a film not only paints a very intelligent picture of our near future, but also succeeds in telling a truly beautiful story.  Everything from the performances, to the socially relevant themes, to the wonderful soundtrack, combines to make this one of the greatest sci fi films of all time.
This movie actually motivated me to create an account for Metacritic. I just hope that more people find this great piece of art by helping to raise the score.
To this day, it’s still my favorite movie. “I never saved anything for the swim back” is one of my fav quotes.
I can't believe how under-appreciated this brilliant work of art is.

This movie was excellent, portrayed an important message perfectly, and had a unique biopunk art style in a leauge of its own. If we could have more of original titles like this, in stead of cookie cutter blockbuster and endless disney sequels, movies would be far better than they are today.
The movie is just brilliant. Great story great direction.....futuristic retro buildings and cars. And above all great actors.....so underestimated. Definitely a must ... to see

This film portrays a realistic possible future, and it explores many important themes. I didn't think much of it when I first saw it, but years have past since then and I still frequently bring it up in all sorts of conversations. It is amazing relevant.

Pour Bienvenue Ã  Gattaca, il est heureux de voir qu'il Ã©chappe Ã  ce sort, haut la main. Mais lÃ , Ã§a serait Ãªtre assez dur (et je le suis souvent) envers ce film quasi parfait, au scÃ©nario incroyablement intelligent, aux acteurs talentueux, Ã  la direction artistique exemplaire et Ã  la mise en scÃ¨ne splendide qui offre au film une ambiance qui lui est bien spÃ©cifique. Bienvenue Ã  Gattaca reste Ã  ce jour le meilleur film d'anticipation qui puisse exister et peut s'en vanter!

In my top 10 sci-fi films of all time. An iconic deeply engrossing film-noir thriller in the near future. Great casting, great direction and photography, excellent dialog and script. An underrated masterpiece.

Enjoyed it thoroughly. Beautifully made with a believable plot and great acting talents from Hawke and Law. Thought he was going to miss his flight  at the end :). Cant believe I have only discovered this film. The underdogs sometimes are the best.

Gattaca is a great dystopian movie. There is a magnificent cast and an interesting interpretation of the dystopian world. Gattaca is an example of a rare subgenre of Biopunk. The story itself is not trivial, despite Happy End and holes in the plot. One of the best dystopian films.

I am not exaggerating when I say Gattaca is he most underrated and unappreciated movie of the last century. Andrew Niccol has crafted a truly beautiful, intelligent and poetic film, accompanied by Michael Nyman's stunning score, it just gets better and better with age. Thurman, Hawke and Law are painfully beautiful and al together wonderfully compelling. Part sci-fi, murder mystery and film noir carefully rolled into one, at it's core lies a simple story about the redemptive power of love. Practically ignored by critics, cinema goers and film buffs upon it's release, one day it may receive the respect and adoration it deserves.

One of the finest science fiction films to ever hit the screen. It is most certainly in my top five. I think "Noop" needs to watch this again. "No essence." What are you on about?. Of course the essence was there and it was in the quite insipid form of discrimination based on a humans DNA which has already started to some degree and in the film relegates those without perfect DNA to the scrap heap and dead end jobs. It is not to hard to imagine the losses to human civilization if such discrimination had existed a hundred or so years ago. For example, Albert Einstein would have been on the scrap heap. Makes you think doesn't it. An excellent script with superb performances by the cast, particularly Jude Law. Again I find myself wishing I could push the scorer further to the right. 10 out of 10 does not give justice to this superb film.

Gattaca is one of the most beautiful, unique, intelligent and heartbreaking science fiction films of all time. The visual aesthetic, music and acting are all absolutely perfect. The movie's lofty metaphors give it credence beyond mere entertainment and it packs a powerful emotional punch. Gattaca is just simply phenomenal.

When I was initially exposed to this film in biology class at fourteen or so, it struck a very deep chord within me. It championed the ideals of perseverance, discipline, and overcoming societally-imposed limitations. It dealt heavily with identity, and the repercussions of eugenics screening, genetic discrimination, and transhumanism. With a talented cast, well-written dialogue, and a moving score, Gattaca is an inspiring and touching film that everybody should see at least once.

Great soundtrack and acting. A couple points in the movie where you roll your eyes but the plot is still strong and engaging. The "follow your dreams" theme has been implemented to death already by other movies but this one really did the idea justice. Very motivating and heartwarming. It's a 7.5 but the lack of attention it gotmakes me want to help it out and lend it an 8

One of the best science fiction films ever made. It excels where many other science fiction movies falter and in my opinion, this movie is up there with Carpenters The Thing and Alien. The story is original and the acting superb, it got everything right. An underrated gem.

This is a really good science fiction film. Ethan Hawke, Uma Thurman, Jude Law, and Alan Arkin, turn in great performances here and you can really feel the emotion in their performances. The score is also brilliant and the thrills/intrigue are provided quite capably by this one. In addition, the sets are effects are really well done. However, where this one truly excels is in its message. A warning about eugenics, Gattaca is not really a science fiction film or a thriller. Rather, it is an inspirational film as it shows that no matter what people think, you can achieve your dreams if you work hard enough to do so, even if there are things that could/will hold you back. In terms of the science fiction, the futuristic elements and technologies are all really well done and developed, plus all are very interesting ideas that may seem implausible now, but could be fact in just a matter of time. The thriller element was also interesting, but since I do not want to spoil too much, I will not mention what I like about it, but it keeps you on edge as you try to see if the cops will figure everything out or not. Overall, Gattaca is a smart, thrilling film that grabs a hold of you early on and does not let go until the film is over.

Gattaca is honestly one of the best science fiction movies I have ever seen. I regret putting off watching it for so long! An incredibly human look at prejudice and how hard it is to get ahead in life when you are given the short end of the stick in society for something completely out of your control.An all-star cast lead by Ethan Hawke, Uma Thurman, and Jude Law will leave you spellbound. Seriously, these three actors are bringing their A-game with their performances. This movie holds up and has aged extremely well. Sci-fi fans cannot miss Gattaca!
A movie with great message, great actors, great script, great idea but unfortunately - not so well delivered. At least on my opinion. I highly recommend it though.

Impressive, exiting, interesting. What was missing is a little bit more back story - why, what, who. One great Sci-Fi, which provide us with an realistic idea of the future. And this is always worth watching.

Intelligent, thought provoking science fiction drama that works because of it's meticulous details accompanying an inventive, plausible screenplay with impressive performances by a stellar cast. In the future, society has been categorized by genetically inferior humans (ones whose lives have already been determined by genetic engineering), or the normal under-classed human. whose fate is determined by knowledge and education. A genetically inferior man Vincent (Hawke) assumes the identity of a superior one (Law) in order to achieve his dream of space travel. Presents a variety of weighty, intriguing topics for introspection. For additional reviews visit http://www.rottentomatoes.com/member/Nesbitt10
Good presentation but no essence. Again science is blamed for society problems. And plot is very dull and predictable too.
It's ideas have a substantial depth to them, and the acting and writing add up to a, not the most extraordinary, but significantly underrated sci-fi film.

A good sci-fi movie...I can relate it with Aldous Huxley's a Brave New World, which is one of my favourite books ever. Ethan Hawkes and Uma Thurman's performances were excellent. My favourite, however, was Jude Law. Good to see him in that role. I highly recommend it. Not an excellent film, but certainly a good one.
Movies in the future are always strange to watch but this one is quite exceptional. The people appeared to have limited personalities but the story is perfect for a science class.
Rich with ethically and scientifically complex thematic material, "Gattaca" not only provides a satisfying narrative, but a thought-provoking one.
"Gattaca" benefits from its well rounded cast and an extremely thought-provoking story, making it an entertainingly inventive sci-fi thriller, even if it gets a little predictable at some parts.

Esta película es sencillamente fenomenal y de otro mundo, demasiada adelantada a su época, incluso hoy en día lo sigue siendo, aborda la temática de la genética y evolución humana de manera muy creativa y elocuente, pero quizás mediante la historia va avanzando y llegando a su momento final llega a ser un tanto confusa ya que mientras es casi totalmente científica, es futurista y metafórica de alguna u otra forma, en mi opinión necesito su tiempo para procesar bien toda la historia para poder entenderla en su totalidad aunque tuviera que verla varias veces más.

Gattaca takes place in a dystopian world where genetic engineering is being applied to children and those that are born naturally are shunned by society. The film is creative in its depiction of the future and poses deeper questions about society and ethics in relation to science. The cinematography and writing are well done and the characters are well fleshed out and have very satisfying arcs throughout the film, I especially liked Jude Law as Jerome.

The ideas that the director wanted to give behind this story line is fantastic. A future where the human society and civilization would depend upon the diference of genes, and that because a human wasent artificially created genetaly it does not mean it can have a bright soul and perspective of life. Niccol as well did a tremendous job in briging close to us to his world.

I was forced to watch this in human genetics class so like any teenager, I was not thrilled at being forced to watch something but this was really cool and held my attention throughout the entire movie..pretty original and entertaining.
Not a popular movie, but a very good one: The dystopian world is very well made, I like such settings. The story is good and changes to be a criminal movie, but more like a cat and mouse game.

Superb cinematography, excellent cast moving soundtrack and great pacing. Gattaca serves as a great callback to classic sci fi with its own stylised vision of a near future Eutopia/distopia. Seminal cinematic experience the holds up well in 2021.

Aldous Huxley's craziest dream takes shape in this movie: your future is determined by your biometric fingerprint from the time you are born. That idea and combining suspense and fiction work quite well and we owe it to the cast for the most part. After watching this movie, you will no longer see those loose hair on your comb.

The writing (storyline, characters, dialog) was nothing great, but boy did I enjoy watching this.  What sumptuous visuals! Smooth, glossy sets, gorgeous faces, and cool costumes. It looks something like an updated version of Lang's Metropolis. And there are some interesting surprises in the cast, like Gore Vidal, Ernest Borgnine, Loren Dean, and Tony Shalhoub. A memorable scifi drama.

When Gattaca was first released, as part of a marketing campaign there were adverts for people to call and have their children genetically engineered. Thousands of people called, wanting to have their offspring genetically engineered.
One of the most heartbreaking sci-fi movies ever made. Soundtrack is amazing.

THE GOOD: Not at all what I expected to see. I'm a sucker for this kind of sci-fi films. Great protagonists and great performances by Ethan Hawke and Jude Law. Also loved the editing, pacing and score. THE BAD: I would have liked to know a bit more about Uma Thurman so that the romance between her and Hawke would have worked better for me.

Esthétique froide et quasi huis clos: la forme rencontre donc admirablement le fond, à savoir une société aseptisée et qui enferme les individus dans un destin déjà écrit. Les tendances au mélodrame, soutenues notamment par une musique larmoyante de bout en bout, rendent cependant le film pénible à regarder. Les qualités du film sont indéniables mais la morale certainement trop présente pour un regard cynique.
